DataElement.preferredName: Troponin T Laboratory Procedure Performed Upper Limit of Normal 3 Decimal Place Microgram per Liter Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The 3 decimal place microgram per liter numeric laboratory value representing the upper level of the normal range of values of troponin T in a specimen.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Troponin I, troponin T, and troponin C are the three closely associated subunits of the troponin complex of thin filaments in muscle.  The complex serves as a calcium-sensitive switch that regulates muscle contraction.  Because it is not normally found in blood, cardiac troponin-T in serum is a sensitive indicator of myocardial cell injury._Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Troponin I, troponin T, and troponin C are the three closely associated subunits of the troponin complex of thin filaments in muscle.  The complex serves as a calcium-sensitive switch that regulates muscle contraction.  Because it is not normally found in blood, cardiac troponin-T in serum is a sensitive indicator of myocardial cell injury.:Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Concepts.definition: Troponin I, troponin T, and troponin C are the three closely associated subunits of the troponin complex of thin filaments in muscle. The complex serves as a calcium-sensitive switch that regulates muscle contraction. Troponin T binds tropomyosin to the troponin complex and inhibits F-actin-myosin interactions. The troponin T gene family comprises three isoforms: slow skeletal (TNNT1), cardiac (TNNT2) and fast skeletal (TNNT3). Because it is not normally found in blood, cardiac troponin-T in serum is a sensitive indicator of myocardial cell injury.
Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Upper Limit of Normal 3 Decimal Place Microgram per Liter Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._The top value of the range of statistical characteristics that are supposed to represent accepted standard, non-pathological pattern for particular laboratory result or other quantitative parameter._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::3_An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers._A unit of mass concentration defined as the concentration of one microgram of a substance per unit volume of the mixture equal to one liter. The concept also refers to the unit of mass density (volumetric mass) defined as the density of a substance which mass equal to one microgram occupies the volume of one liter._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.
The top value of the range of statistical characteristics that are supposed to represent accepted standard, non-pathological pattern for particular laboratory result or other quantitative parameter.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.

A unit of mass concentration defined as the concentration of one microgram of a substance per unit volume of the mixture equal to one liter. The concept also refers to the unit of mass density (volumetric mass) defined as the density of a substance which mass equal to one microgram occupies the volume of one liter.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
